EzScript
docs.text:
A programming language that compiles to HTML, written entirely in Python, meant to simplify website coding. Heres an example of EzScript: 

<title> cool ezscript website
<heading> this is a heading
<text> yo

Compiles into:

<title>cool ezscript website</title>
<h1 style="font-family: Arial;">this is a heading</h1>
<p style="font-family: Arial;">yo</p>

docs.title: Other Languages
docs.text: You can even use Lua and Python in EzScript!

docs.title: Static
docs.text: All sites are static, since it is HTML, even adding other languages (like Lua) it will still be a static site!

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Click here to view the releases of EzScript.

docs.title: Beta Download
docs.text: On our GitHub repo you can clone it to your local machine and run build.bat, however we only support windows building, but if you want to make it for other platforms make a pull request.

docs.title: Starting Out
docs.text:
All EzScript releases are avilable here select the latest version and download it.

Note: EzScript only supports Windows version in the releases tab, so for other operating systems you have to build it yourself

I recomended using VSCode as your code editor, it is also what i'll be using in this tutorial.

Open ezscript.exe and you should see something like this Simpily type 1 and press enter. After you have done that drag ezscript.exe into ezproject. Now click where the arrow is pointed and type cmd in the box. You should be in command prompt now just type

code .

Now your in VSCode!
